intro: Swertia woodii, commonly known as the Himalayan gentian, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stem is upright and branched. Swertia woodii is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
